TextAsset.value: This looks like a great spot to start digging!
Uh, sure, I guess so.
There’s plenty of dirt around, anyway.
What are we digging for, exactly?
Haha, what?
That’s silly…
Digging for…
Um…
What do you mean?
I don’t understand the question.
(I guess he just digs for the sake of it?)
Well, since you left all your digging supplies at home, you can borrow one of my shovels.
It’s pretty amateur hour, no real options for specialized excavation techniques or anything…
But it might be fun to do some old-school digging, like when you were a kid, huh?
(I never did any digging when I was a kid!
I don’t HAVE any digging tools either…
In fact, I’ve never dug anything before in my entire life.
Maybe I should get some digging tools when I get home…
Jeez, how much is this little crush gonna cost me?!)
Ok! Let’s get started! Boy, I’m so excited!
(This digging thing…
I’m not sure I’m so good at it.
The shovel is pretty awkward to use!
Still, Mr. Driller is having a lot of fun…
It’s very nice to see him less stressed.
Although it seems a little like he’s destroying as much as he’s digging.
Well, c’est la vie!)
Phew! That’s a wrap, Digging Club!
What a great first day!
Phew! What a workout!
Ha! OH YEAH!
It feels so good to finally get digging again!
How could Dad ever give this up?!
Haha… if I didn’t love my dad so much I’d probably say it was because he’s a washed up coward who’s afraid to really LIVE!
Ha ha… Ha!
...Yeah… Dads. Always telling you what to do...
Embarrassing you in front of your friends…
Trying to crush your spirit into little tiny molecules of gravel, even though they don’t have the stones to work with REAL gravel anymore…
That’s the way it is with every family!
I’m sure you know the drill.
(...Yikes.)
Alright! Shall we forget about how horrible our stupid ugly dads are…
and get back to DIGGING?!
(Hey, I like my family!
I have the feeling that’s not what he wants to hear, though.
And anyway, I have… less depressing things to discuss. Well, hopefully.)
Mr. Driller… before you say anymore, I-
I have to confess something to you!
A post-digging confession??
That’s the best kind!
The truth is… digging with you out there…
It’s the first time I’ve ever dug anything in my whole life!
I don’t actually have any of my own digging supplies.
Not even like, a plastic shovel for a sandbox.
… Oh…
Then…
Why did you found the Digging Club with me?
Well… because you needed my help!
And you asked so nicely…
${slot:playerName}!
You…
You are a true friend!
Any treasure I could find would never be better than true friendship!
Except maybe a huge diamond…
Those are worth like a million points I think.
Aw, well.
I was happy to do it!
But if you joined a club to help MY passion…
Is there some other club you’d have rather pursued?
What’s YOUR passion, ${slot:playerName}?
Everyone’s got one! Everyone in the WHOLE WORLD!
(Hmmm, I’ve got to think hard about that before I answer him.
...Now that I stop to think of it…
I think I really have a passion for rolling my katamari.
I’m not as good as my cousin the Prince, but…
When I was rolling it the other day-
It was just so much fun! It felt right.
But I caused so much trouble and hurt so many people…
As much as it saddens me, I don’t think I should ever roll my katamari again.
It’s just not worth the pain it causes.
But I don’t want to say that in front of Mr. Driller.
A passionate guy like him…
He keeps finding ways to do what he loves, even though his dad won’t let him…
I can’t help but think he’d look down on me, for quitting so easily.)
What’s wrong? Is it too much of a personal question?
Heh, n-no, not at all…
It’s just…
That I don’t know what my passion is yet!
I’m kind of envious of you, Mr. Driller.
Oh! Well… maybe your passion can be digging, too!
Maybe it was FATE that led you to found the Digging Club with me!
And if my dad says no-
(Why would his dad say no to ME?!)
We can just smack him right in the mouth!
With our heavy, heavy shovels.
…Heh...
Um…
Oh relax ${slot:playerName}! It’s a joke!
I love my Dad! He’s family!
I love him so much you might even say I…
dig
him!
Even though he disapproves of my digging anything ever for the rest of my life.
(This guy…
He’s cute, but…
It looks like my impression that he’s a big pile of issues was 100% correct.
...Well, nobody’s perfect! I’m sure I have issues with stuff too.
Maybe if I try to understand him a little better, I’ll understand why he gets so… dark.)
This might be a silly question, but…
Why do you love digging so much, anyway?
OH MY GOODNESS!
What’s NOT to love about digging?!
...And, there’s SO many tools you can use for digging!
But that’s not even the MAIN reason I love digging so much…
Well, what IS the main reason?
(C’mon, you’ve been talking FOREVER…)
Well, it’s…
It’s just that digging…
It’s about…
Discovery.
(Something in his face changed…
I feel weirdly inspired just seeing his eyes light up like that.)
When you dig, you’re going under the surface…
Past it.
You dig further and further.
Most people walk around on the ground and never even once think about what’s under there.
But there’s a whole world of amazing things waiting for you to find!
Uh, really?
It kinda looked like you were just…
Destroying stuff by digging through it.
But don’t you get it? That’s about discovery too!
If you dig into something, and you break it open-
You get to find out what’s inside of it.
See? And…
There’s always more inside of it than you ever imagined.
Yeah…
Actually, I see what you mean.
Mr. Driller… that’s really cool.
I wish…
I wish I could hold onto my passion like you.
...It was my dad, DigDug, who encouraged me…
Huh? The guy you hate so much, the one that’s stressing you out…
He’s the one who made you want to dig stuff in the first place?!
Whoah whoah! I don’t hate my dad!
It’s just… Isn’t it normal for teenagers to clash with their parents?
I’m sure you’ve gotten mad and shut yourself in a room before…
Or snuck out to meet friends…
Or just got so upset over something he said that you dug a big big hole, six feet deep, and sat there just staring desperately into it until the sun came up…
That’s all normal stuff!
Ummm…
Sure…
But still, it’s surprising that your dad used to be into digging too.
(Although, come to think of it, his name IS “Dig Dug”.)
Yeah, I don’t know what to do about that…
I keep thinking… if Dad would just remember how important it is to dig!
After all… he was a digging LEGEND once.
He was even kinda my hero.
Just keep digging in secret!
If he’s forbidding you, maybe it’s okay to lie about it, given the circumstances.
...But… he’s my father.
Didn’t I just tell you, he’s the one you encouraged me to dig in the first place?
Well, I mean…
Yeah, but…
I want to dig up my problems and break them open.
Not bury them down where they’ll stay forever…
I don’t want to lie to my dad. He’s important to me.
Besides… you shouldn’t have to hide your passion!
That’s… a disrespect…
to the art of digging!
I… I guess so.
But isn’t that what your dad did? Buried his passion for digging away?
N-not that you should disrespect the art of digging or anything, but…
It’d be pretty hypocritical of him to give you flak for that, right?
I never thought of it exactly like that before…
I guess that’s true… he DID disrespect the art.
Heh! Classic Dad.
Every time you think he can’t disappoint you any further, he finds a way!
Like a hole you keep digging and digging and you’ll never ever find the bottom!
You know how it is.
Uh… yeah…
Exactly?
But no… I can’t do it.
I love digging too much to hide it.
I don’t exactly know what to do next.
But… maybe I’ll discover it as I dig along!
(This guy’s... really out of his depth, to say the least.
But his passion is pretty cool. Maybe I could help…)
...I’m glad you have such strong convictions, Mr. Driller.
Don’t worry, ${slot:playerName}.
Even if you haven’t found your passion yet…
That’s kinda what highschool is for, isn’t it?
But you know, if you liked digging…
I highly recommend it!
Haha, yeah…
I know you do.
(Is it healthy to be that consumed with just one thing?
Maybe Mr. Driller doesn’t have room in his heart for digging AND… someone special.
...Well, it’s like he said… digging is about discovery.
I won’t find out if I don’t keep digging, too.)
